availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1859-1862

body.p:
Commonwealth of Ky
Pendleton County } Sct

This day Personally appeared before the undersigned, a Justice of the peace for said county, A. G. Wileman (who produced a commission from his Excellency the Governor of the commonwealth of Ky. Commissioning him a captain of a company of volunteer militia) who took the oath required by law, this 22nd day of Nov 1861
G. C. Lightfoot J. P. P. C

Commonwealth of Ky
Pendleton County } Sct

This day personally Appeared before the undersigned a Justice of the peace for Said County, Samuel S. Patterson. (who presented a commission from his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky. Commissioning him a first Lieutenant of a company of volunteer militia) who took the oath required by law, this 27th day of November 1861
G. C. Lightfoot J. P. P. C

Commonwealth of Kentucky
Pendleton County } Sct,

This day personally appeared before the undersigned a Justice of the peace for Said County, James H. Johns. (who presented a commission from his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky. Commissioning him a Second Lieutenant, of a company of volunteer militia, who took the oath required by law, this 27th day of November 1861
G. C. Lightfoot J. P. P. C.
